NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: The linelist package provides a storage mechanism in the R software for case line list data (the most common type of epidemiological data), as well as ‘accessors’ to retrieve specific data fields. The entire package is open-source, including these accessors. We assume that data will be mostly non-PII, but it is the user's responsibility to ensure that confidentiality is respected if they store PII in their linelist.

privacyComplianceList: The software provides a data format for storing case line list data, and routines to handle/retrieve this data. Like other open document formats such as ods, it makes no assumption on the degree of confidentiality of the data stored. We provide a privacy disclaimer on our website

bestPracticesList: Unit testing and full (100%) code coverage

preventHarm.additionalInfoMechanismProcessesPolicies: The package implements safeguards against the accidental loss of key epidemiological variables.

typesOfDataCollected: Users of Aam Digital are social sector organozations and therefore can decide to collect and process special categories of personal data (Art. 9 GDPR). technical error reports from devices (using Sentry.io). usage analytics to understand how users are interacting with the app (using Matomo, self-hosted)
dataPrivacySecurity.privacySecurityDescription: The package implements safeguards against the accidental loss of key epidemiological variables.

stepsAddressRiskPreventSafetyUnderageUse: linelist is a data processing software package and not an online communication platform, where the risk of harassment would require elaborate prevention mechanisms. However, our project encourages collaboration between developers and end-users, typically health professionals. These interactions are protected by our code of conduct, which is documented on our website
